info.name: Bookmarks Menu in Multiple Columns (Firefox 32-69)
info.description:
Multicolumn Bookmarks Menu - divides the Bookmarks Menu on Firefox's classic menu bar into three columns, and bookmark folders are displayed in two columns. Firefox 71: Argh. How about dumping this rule and using a vertical scrollbar? See: http://forums.mozillazine.org/viewtopic.php?f=38&t=3056311. *** Attention Firefox 57+ or Stylish 3.0 users ***
Expand the "Show CSS Code" panel and copy/paste into a userChrome.css file.
More information on creating a userChrome.css file: How to Create a userChrome.css File. ** UPDATED ** Styles toolbar drop-down menu (Firefox 58 or Firefox 52 ESR) and folders on the Bookmarks Toolbar. (Tested on Windows only so far.)

Old version: https://forum.userstyles.org/discussion/63949/broken.
